string.text: We'll watch the yard\nin the meantime.
Goodness. They had it hard.
I doubt\nanyone could've survived this.
Here's our first\nscientist casualty.
What did this to him?
Faster, faster! We're leaving.
We don't need more trouble.
He had his chance,\nbut didn't help us.
I don't deal with such parasites.
Now, get back to base.
Shit. I knew he'd cause trouble!
Koval, come in.\nYou done with your equipment?
Come in. Do you read?
It's all because of the emitter.
Half of the assistants\ncomplained about such symptoms.
Let's go\nshut it off already. Move out!
Okay, boys, we're here.
I suggest we make our camp here.
It's a high spot,\nwhole area is easily visible.
Sky, you stay with the pilot.
While we're gone, prepare a mobile HQ.
I hope you can connect to the satellite
so that we can stay informed\nabout what's happening here.
The rest of us move to the mobile bunker.
Keep on the lookout. Let's go!
They know what they were in for\nwhen they signed the contract.
I'm sure that, even if they knew\nwhat would come of them,
they'd have gone to the Zone anyway.
Scum! Let me go!
For the love of god, I beg you!
Aaah, no!
Let go, let go!
Stalker
Help me!
It's over there, in the fog!
Come on, shoot it!
You've been with them for long?
Everything is under control.\nYou saw the launch plans, calculations.
There's no danger.\nSakharov knows what he's doing.
Okay, fair point.
Then let's just get out of here
and let them\ndeal with the installation themselves.
You crazy?
They'll either imprison\nor whack you, you idiot.
They're just waiting\nto pull the trigger on us!
I don't know. What if...
I'm not with anyone.
Stalkers didn't shut off\nthe installation for nothing.
We should've locked all entrances\nand never gone back down again.
Who thought it was a good idea\nto conduct new tests?
You're lying to yourself.\nCan't you feel what's happening to us?
Half of the bunker\nis complaining about headaches!
You don't think it's related to the brain?
No way.
What about our boys?
We've researched the Zone together\nfor so long.
Do we just leave them to die?
No. I'll try to destroy the installation.
They won't if I do it quietly.
Besides, some guys are willing to help me.
So, are you with me?
Shh. Quiet!
There's someone here.
Hear that noise in the corner?
Commander, keep up!
Catch up with me, boss! Where'd you go?
Keep up. What are you doing?
See you.
Well, bye. See you.
Bye, boss.
You, uh, let me know\nif anything happens.
Go on, then. Good luck.
Go, I'll make it on my own. Don't worry about me.
I'll set up the equipment. Keep your eyes peeled, will you?
Just in time!
Speak up. What've you got?
I'm listening, commander.
What is it, commander?
Hello.
Something important or nah?
Don't get mad, commander.\nIt won't happen again.
Commander, come on upstairs, we'll cover you. Just hurry up, there are a lot of them here!
Commander, why? Just let him go and let him wander around to the Yantar. Too many people have died here already...
You all right, Commander? Any more and we'd have been finished for sure. You knocked that puzzle out just in time.
See you later.
See you.
Bye, commander.
I feel sorry for them. All those scientists, guards, stalkers. They're just gonna stay here. No one to bury them.
It's just so frustrating. It's a shame that this whole thing happened because of some ridiculous...
Hey, commander!
Hello.
Glad to see you!
Commander, there's something really wrong here. I'm a little shaky too.
Commander, I'm watching the neighbourhood now and I think I saw something. Something strange.
Commander, zombies!
Hey, stalker! Come on, get up, it's time to work!
Here we go, the door's off its hinges.
You can come in.
Hold on, commander.\nThe door won't budge yet.
Take your time here.\nit's not that simple.
It won't open, damn it.\nDo something else for now.
I'll try to figure out the door.
Talk to you later.
See you.
Bye, commander.
Be waiting for orders.
Need anything, talk to me.
Commander, glad to see you!
Hey, boss!
Hey there.
I'm listening, commander.
Need anything?
What's happening in the bunker?
Today is our last day preparing to fully launch the installation.
Activating it will help us advance in researching psy-activity.
We are currently in full control of the brain's operation,
therefore its emissions will not go beyond the marked zone.
That means we can fully control its power
and, better yet, pick specific targets to influence.
The nasty snorks at the lake will surely enjoy it.
I don't care if I get imprisoned or shot.
I can't keep ignoring what's happening in the laboratory.
Almost everyone is complaining about headaches,
and the installation is only in standby mode.
If they activate it, we're done for.
I've read the documentation. I know how to disable it
so that the brain atrophies and won't ever work again.
Most people will be grateful for that.
I hope I can steal the control room key without trouble
and do everything quietly and discreetly.
Help!
Anyone who can hear us...
[messages with interference]
[messages with interference]
Do you read me?
Radioactivity check on the surface is a success.
Radiation levels are normal, so there's no need to worry.
Just need to check the hang...
[explosion]
Zhuravlyov, come in!
I caught Koval's signal. He's by the factory, near the arch-anomaly.
Perfect! The emissions are almost down.
It's safe by the breach now. Get going!
Zhuravlyov, I have some info from the bunker data.
There's a stalker body
next to the collapsed entrance to laboratory X16.
To reach it, you'll need to activate the cooling station in the hangar of the factory area.
After that, the psy-emissions around the breach should stabilize, and we'll be able to reach the poor fellow's body.
I can't understand where the emissions come from, since their main source is practically destroyed...
but I suppose anything's possible. Here are the coordinates.
One more thing: the cooling station was formerly operated by some stalker named Lefty,
so you won't have to stay there for long.
Sakharov's laptop tells me you only have to press a button.
Good luck!
Squad, do you copy?
I tried establishing comms with the satellite, but it's no use,
so we only have radio contact.
It must be the reason we didn't get any signals from survivors... if anyone even survived, that is.
I launched the drone. It'll scan the area for movement and anomalous activity.
There's no visual feed. Something here must be jamming it.
Sensors indicate that everything's fine for now. I'll keep you posted if anything comes up.
Out.
Squad, do you copy?
Northwest of you is a weak PDA signal.
All I know is that it's someone living.
I've marked the location on your maps.
Careful, Zhuravlyov. The signal is moving rapidly in your direction!
200 meters to target.
100 meters. See anyone?
No sign of him in camp either, and I can't pick up his signal.
I'll fill you in if anything happens.
Something just exploded in the factory!
The earth started quaking, and it's like I was hit in the head with a bat.
It might have something to do with our project... though what might've gone wrong?
Roman Sergeyevich went to check the hangar for radioactive contamination.
Some of the bunker's research assistants complained about sensors going off scale.
I've cooperated with Volnov, who has had many questions about how the installation works.
At the same time, I'll find out what's got him so interested.
What if Sakharov had a point about a possible failure of the experiments?
Control room
Security, we have an emergency!
Prokhorov just burst into my office and smashed me in the head.
He grabbed the keys to the control room while I was out of it.
I don't know what he's up to, but he must be stopped.
The installation is located there. If anything happens to it, we're done for!
I've had it with that god-awful emitter. Why did they even put it here?
Not only doesn't it work properly, but it won't connect to the science facility.
Send over your almighty technician already. He's the one who made it, so have him deal with his own shit invention.
You hear me? Come in, do you read? You dogs!
The door's open. Come here.
Aaah!
Team 7 and 9, quickly to the control room!
There's an egghead dickhead shooting people with a machine gun.
Three dead bodies already!
Roger that, let's move out!
Hurry up, guys!
Don't let him get to the installation!
You can't touch the brain right now!!!
The installation is unstable and can have fatal consequences!
Well, get out of here, dummy, and stop him!
He's got his dressing gown on and he's calling the shots, bitch.
You don't understand! If he gets his hands on that remote, we're all dead!
All of them! Do you understand?
Okay, don't yell. We'll think of something.
